content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace any leading or trailing whitespaces with nothing
    col = strip(col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")

    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input, converts it to lowercase, removes any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The cleaned column name is then returned by the function.
